column4: is there anyway to have KDE and GNOME installed but without KDE apps in GNOME menus and vice versa?
you could use smeg to remove the KDE apps from your gnome menu manually
There must be a KDE menu editor as well ... but I don't use KDE, so i don't know it.
i found this http://ubuntu.wordpress.com/2006/01/13/ubuntu-to-kubuntu-keeping-the-menus-clean/ but I dont know how to make and run a .sh
